title: Express.js
text: Express.js, or simply Express, is a back end web application framework for building RESTful APIs with Node.js, released as free and open-source software under the MIT License. It is designed for building web applications and APIs. It has been called the de facto standard server framework for Node.js

title: Uniqid()
text:
A Unique Hexatridecimal ID generator.
It will always create unique id's based on the current time, process and machine name.

title: express.static()
text: The express. static() function is a built-in middleware function in Express. It serves static files and is based on serve-static. Parameters: The root parameter describes the root directory from which to serve static assets.

title: util.promisify()
text: Takes a function following the common Node.js callback style, i.e. taking a (err, value) => â€¦ callback as the last argument, and returns a version that returns promises.
